  sgcool_label_text: This aquatint presents a naval battle scene between the British and French in the Straits of Malacca on 15 February 1804. Painted and engraved by William Daniell
 this print is dedicated to Sir Nathaniel Dance
 who captained a fleet of East Indiamen in engaging and sucessfully repulsing a squadron of French Men of War. For his efforts
 Dance was knighted on his return to England.

metadata.title_text: The Homeward Bound Fleet of Indiamen from China
metadata.physical_appearance: This print depicts a naval battle scene. Rows of indiamen are strategically positioned.The sea appears calm and the tuft of white that cuts across the center composition represents canons that have been fired.
metadata.subject_terms_2: France Aquatint Engraving Malacca, Strait of Drawing Naval battles in art Great Britain Indiamen China
metadata.context_1: Sir Nathaniel Dance, as captain of a fleet of British East Indiamen successfully defeated a French squadron off the Straits of Malacca on 15 February 1804.
metadata.context_20: Site where the British fleet defeated the French Squadron
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This aquatint presents a naval battle scene between the British and French in the Straits of Malacca on 15 February 1804. Painted and engraved by William Daniell, this print is dedicated to Sir Nathaniel Dance, who captained a fleet of East Indiamen in engaging and sucessfully repulsing a squadron of French Men of War. For his efforts, Dance was knighted on his return to England.
